title: The literature on IBM PC-compatible personal computers, the Intel 80x86 microprocessor family, and assembly-language and C programming is vast. The list below contains a selection of those books that I have found to be useful and reliable. The list should not be construed as an endorsement by Microsoft Corporation

note: CTutorials Microsoft C Programming for the IBM, by Robert Lafore. Howard K. Sams
title: Brady Books, Simon and Schuster

note: Programmer's Guide to PC & PS/2 Video Systems, by Richard Wilton.
title: PC/AT, and PS/2 Architecture The IBM Personal Computer from the Inside Out
